result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 12CF884, 13CF624 and 14CF515 called: 10:04am
(Court also called 12CF228 - COURT notes defendant already sentenced in this case)
State appears by ADA K.Mayo for DDA Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Suzanne O'Neill

State moves for entry of judgment in 12CF884 - Ct. 1.
COURT enters judgment of guilt in 12CF884 - Ct. 1.
Stat moves to:
13CF624>>D&RI entire file
14CF515>>D&RI entire file
COURT grants above

COURT orders PSI to be completed - State requests that matters be set for CC 9/11/14 as these are DDA Wetzsteon's cases; COURT grants.
Bond continues in 12CF884.
(ADA Mayo to remind DDA Wetzsteon that writ will be necessary.)

Adj: 10:09am

Case called:  8:34 am
Clerk: Kim
12CF884, 13CF624 and 14CF515

State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon
Defendant appears in custody w/Atty Suzanne O'Neill

State informs Court date and time set for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing in 14CF624, file 12CF884 tracking with 13CF624.  COURT notes revocation of probation resulted in prison.  Atty O'Neill states waiting for plea agreement before setting next Court as defendant is to be transferred to prision within the next two weeks.   COURT questions jail. Jail states defendant is not scheduled to go yet.  Parties to get PTC and Tentative Plea dates right after Court.  Jail to have defendant remain in custody until Tentative Plea date.  

Waiver of  Prelim filed in 14CF515.  Court questions defendant regarding Waiver of Prelim.   Court finds Waiver freely & vol. made, finds probable cause & binds deft over for trial.  Information filed.  Arraignment.  Plea:  Not guilty (each count)
Bond continues.  
Adj.  8:39 am
Waiver of Prelim on September 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Case called: 10:38am.  Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and prose for today. Atty Suzanne O'Neill does not appear and out of the office. Matter set for Prelim. Public Defenders Office called and they are unaware who is covering for Atty O'Neill. Defendant will waive time limits. Crt accepts waiver of time limits. Bond Continue. DATES: PTC 8/20/14 @ 10:15am. CC: BR4. Adjourned: 10:30am.
